titleStmt.title: His Majesties letter to His right trusty, and well-beloved subjects, the Aldermen and Common-Councell of the city of London, to be communicated to all His loyall subjects within the cities of London and Westminster. Brought by the Duke of Richmond. Novemb. 7. 1648. And Col. Hammonds declaration concerning the King, for preservation of His royall person from the hands of His enemies; and his protestation touching the same. With a message from the army to the said Col. Hamond, and their propositions and desires touching the person of the King, and their design touching the treaty. Dated at Newport Nevem. 6. and brought by the post Yesterday.
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1625-1649 : Charles I)

titleStmt.title: His Majesties letter to His right trusty, and well-beloved subjects, the Aldermen and Common-Councell of the city of London, to be communicated to all His loyall subjects within the cities of London and Westminster. Brought by the Duke of Richmond. Novemb. 7. 1648. And Col. Hammonds declaration concerning the King, for preservation of His royall person from the hands of His enemies; and his protestation touching the same. With a message from the army to the said Col. Hamond, and their propositions and desires touching the person of the King, and their design touching the treaty. Dated at Newport Nevem. 6. and brought by the post Yesterday.
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1625-1649 : Charles I)

notesStmt.note: Page one has caption title: Joyfull newes for the Princes Navie and a great victory obtuined [sic] at sea: with the particulars thereof, and the manner of the fight. Sent in a letter from the navy the 4 of Novemb. 1648.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
